ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.User

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.ElasticStorable
      • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.User.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable, Friendable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoggedInUser

    public class User
extends ElasticStorable
implements Observable, Friendable
    Abstract class representing a user of the app. This user may be either the LoggedInUser or a Friend. This class mainly acts as a container for all of the various classes that make up a user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • User

        public User()
        Public constructor for user: initializes all attribute classes as empty classes with no active data. This constructor is called when the application has no information about the user (i.e. a new User) or when not all information about the user is available yet.

      • User

    Inventory inventory,

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
        Adds the specified observer to the list of observers. If it is already registered, it is not added a second time.
        Specified by:
        addObserver in interface Observable
        Parameters:
        observer - the Observer to add.

      • deleteObserver

        public void deleteObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
        Removes the specified observer from the list of observers. Passing null won't do anything.
        Specified by:
        deleteObserver in interface Observable
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer to remove.

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        If hasChanged() returns true, calls the update() method for every observer in the list of observers using null as the argument. Afterwards, calls clearChanged().

        Equivalent to calling notifyObservers(null).

        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface Observable

      • getNeedToSave

        public java.lang.Boolean getNeedToSave()
        Returns whether User's data needs to be locally cached. This variable is set when a change is made to the User's data.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • setNeedToSave

        protected void setNeedToSave(java.lang.Boolean needToSave)
        Sets whether User data needs to be locally cached. This Boolean should on be set only when changes to the User's data is made.
        Parameters:
        needToSave -
